description: Fan-shaped overlapping shelves 5-14 cm across with finely suede-like texture. Pale salmon orange to pinkish orange when young, fading over time. Lemon-yellow pore surface with tiny pores (2-3 per mm), pale yellow to white flesh.
habitat: Dead or dying hardwood trees, especially oak and eucalyptus. Grows on stumps and logs in large overlapping clusters. Does NOT grow on conifers (unlike related species).
season: Western US/California: Late summer to early fall (August-October). Most productive August through October.
lookalikes: L. conifericola - grows on conifers (different species, edibility questionable)
safety_notes: Must be thoroughly cooked. Some people experience digestive upset, especially from specimens on eucalyptus trees. Try small amounts first to test tolerance. Only harvest young, tender outer edges.
